intro: Hieracium albicans, commonly known as the white hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its white flowers, which resemble a cluster of small blossoms, bloom from June to August. The leaves are generally hairy and lobed, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
